articles.author: SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: CAIRO (AP) — More than 1,000 people died during this year’s Hajj pilgrimage in Saudi Arabia as the faithful faced extreme high temperatures at Islamic holy sites in the desert kingdom, officials said Sunday.
articles.title: Over 1,000 pilgrims died during this year's Hajj pilgrimage in Saudi Arabia, officials say

articles.author: TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told his Cabinet on Sunday that there had been a “dramatic drop” in U.S. weapons deliveries for Israel's war effort in Gaza, doubling down on a claim that the Biden administration has denied and underscoring the growing strains between the two allies.
articles.title: Netanyahu again claims the US is withholding arms shipments, days after Washington denies it

articles.author: ED WHITE and JOHN HANNA
articles.description: Floodwaters forced people out of their homes in parts of Iowa, the result of weeks of rain, while much of the United States longed for relief Saturday from yet another round of extraordinary heat.Sirens blared at 2 a.m.
articles.title: Flooding forces people from homes in some parts of Iowa while much of US broils again in heat

articles.description: RUIDOSO, N.M. (AP) — Federal authorities offered a reward for information about those responsible for igniting a pair of New Mexico wildfires that killed two people and destroyed hundreds of homes in the past week.
articles.title: FBI offers reward for information about deadly southern New Mexico wildfires

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Behind the smiles, the balloons and the red-carpet pageantry of President Vladimir Putin's visit to North Korea last week, a strong signal came through: In the spiraling confrontation with the U.S.
articles.title: With its new pact with North Korea, Russia raises the stakes with the West over Ukraine

articles.author: KIM TONG-HYUNG
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — A nuclear-powered U.S. aircraft carrier arrived Saturday in South Korea for a three-way exercise involving Japan as they step up military training to cope with North Korean threats, which have escalated following a security pact with Russia.
articles.title: US aircraft carrier arrives in South Korea as a show of force against nuclear-armed North Korea

articles.author: BASSEM MROUE and QASSIM ABDUL-ZAHRA
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Thousands of fighters from Iran-backed groups in the Middle East are ready to come to Lebanon to join with the militant Hezbollah group in its battle with Israel if the simmering conflict escalates into a full-blown war, officials with Iran-backed factions and analysts say.
articles.title: Thousands of Iran-backed fighters offer to join Hezbollah in its fight against Israel

articles.author: SAMYA KULLAB
articles.description: KHARKIV REGION, Ukraine (AP) — Weeks after the decision allowing Ukraine to use U.S.-supplied weapons for limited strikes in Russian territory, the country is having some success in halting Russia’s new push along the northeast front, but military commanders are clamoring for restrictions on long-range missiles to be lifted.
articles.title: As U.S.-supplied weapons show impact inside Russia, Ukrainian soldiers hope for deeper strikes

articles.author: MICHELLE L. PRICE and AYANNA ALEXANDER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Donald Trump told a group of evangelicals they “cannot afford to sit on the sidelines” of the 2024 election, imploring them at one point to “go and vote, Christians, please!"
articles.title: Trump endorses Ten Commandments in schools, implores evangelical Christians to vote in November

articles.author: KIMBERLEE KRUESI, CHRISTINE FERNANDO and LEAH WILLINGHAM
articles.description: CHARLESTON, W.Va. (AP) — Tucked inside the West Virginia Statehouse is a copy of a petition to lawmakers with a simple request: Let the voters decide whether to reinstate legal access to abortion.The request has been ignored by the Republican lawmakers who have supermajority control in the Legislature and banned abortions in the state in 2022, shortly after the U.S.
articles.title: Abortion access has won when it's been on the ballot. That’s not an option for half the states
